Dirut Bandingkan Iuran BPJS Kesehatan dengan Pulsa, DPR Protes Keras
06 Nov 2019, 18:45 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Dirut Bandingkan Iuran BPJS Kesehatan dengan Pulsa, DPR Protes Keras

KBRN, Jakarta : Pernyataan Direktur Utama (Dirut) Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan, Fachmi Idris yang menyebut besaran iuran premi asuransi lebih murah dibandingkan dengan harga pulsa diprotes keras. Protes keras itu disampaikan oleh Anggota Komisi IX DPR RI, Saleh Partaonan Daulay.
Saleh yang juga politisi Partai Amanat Nasional (PAN) ini menegaskan, Fachmi Idris tidak semestinya membandingkan antara besaran iuran BPJS Kesehatan dengan pulsa. Sebab iuran BPJS Kesehatan merupakan kebutuhan primer, sedangkan pulsa hanyalah kebutuhan sekunder atau tersier."Iuran BPJS Kesehatan lebih murah dibandingkan dengan pulsa telepon. Ini tidak komparatif, kompatibel. Saya protes, benar-benar protes,” tegasnya dalam rapat kerja di Gedung Nusantara I, Senayan, Jakarta, Rabu (6/11/2019).Lebih lanjut Saleh juga melayangkan protes atas pernyataan Fachmi yang menyatakan pembayaran premi BPJS Kesehatan setara dengan Rp 2.000 per hari. Sebab menurut dia, pernyataan yang terkesan menyederhanakan masalah tersebut bakalan menimbulkan kontroversi di tengah masyarakat. “Karena saat ini orang yang gajinya Rp 20 ribu sampai 30 ribu per hari masih ada. Kalau satu keluarga menambung Rp 2.000 per orang sedangkan anggota keluarga berjumlah lima orang, itu sudah enggak sebanding,” sesal Saleh.Perlu diketahui, kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan tertuang dalam Peraturan Presiden (Perpres) Nomor 75 Tahun 2019 tentang Perubahan atas Perpres Nomor 82 Tahun 2018 tentang Jaminan Kesehatan.Perpres tersebut mengatur kenaikan iuran BPJS Kesehatan kelas 3 menjadi Rp. 42 ribu/ bulan, kelas 2 menjadi Rp. 110 ribu/ bulan dan kelas 1 menjadi Rp. 160 ribu/bulan. Iuran baru BPJS kesehatan akan berlaku per Januari 2020 nanti.Rapat kerja ini tak hanya dihadiri oleh Dirut BPJS Kesehatan beserta jajarannya. Hadir pula dalam rapat itu Menteri Kesehatan RI, Terawan Agus Putranto dan lain-lain.

Managing Director Compare Health Insurance BPJS Dues with Pulses, DPR Protests Strongly
Nov 6 2019, 18:45 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Managing Director Compare Health Insurance BPJS Dues with Pulses, DPR Protests Strongly

KBRN, Jakarta: Statement of the Managing Director (Managing Director) of the Social Security Organizing Agency (BPJS) for Health, Fachmi Idris, who said the amount of insurance premium contributions is cheaper than the price of hard-to-protest pulses. The strong protest was conveyed by Member of the House of Representatives Commission IX, Saleh Partaonan Daulay.
Saleh, who is also a politician from the National Mandate Party (PAN), emphasized that Fachmi Idris should not compare the amount of BPJS Health contributions with pulses. Because BPJS Health fees are a primary need, while pulses are only secondary or tertiary needs. "BPJS Health contributions are cheaper than telephone pulses. This is not comparative, compatible. I protest, really protest," he said in a working meeting at Nusantara I Building , Senayan, Jakarta, Wednesday (6/11/2019). Furthermore, Saleh also protested Fachmi's statement that the BPJS Health premium payment was equivalent to Rp 2,000 per day, because according to him, a statement that seemed to simplify the problem would cause controversy in "Because currently there are still people whose salaries are Rp. 20 thousand to 30 thousand per day. If one family makes Rp. 2,000 per person while family members number five, it is not comparable," regrets Saleh. BPJS Health stated in Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 75 Year 2019 concerning Amendment to Perpres Number 82 Year 201 8 on Health Insurance. The Presidential Regulation regulates the increase in BPJS Health grade 3 contributions to Rp. 42 thousand / month, class 2 becomes Rp. 110 thousand / month and class 1 to Rp. 160 thousand / month. The new BPJS health contribution will take effect as of January 2020. This work meeting is not only attended by the Director of BPJS Health and its staff. Also present at the meeting were the Minister of Health of the Republic of Indonesia, Terawan Agus Putranto and others.
